result.execSummary:
All charges against Zachary William Burris in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Zachary William Burris is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary William Burris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zachary William Burris in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case in court for a Jury Trial.  State's witness is not available and the State is unable to proceed. Defense moves to dismiss the case. Court ordered case dismissed.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7-27-2022

Defendant Zachary William Burris in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Final pretrial proceeded.  State's offer stated on the record.  Defense rejects State's offer.  Case remains in jury trial posture.  Case is adjourned to 7-27-22 at 8:30 am for Jury Trial.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine

Defendant Zachary William Burris in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Zachary William Burris appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Victim appeared by zoom.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Zachary William Burris in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Attorney Rebholz was just appointed to the case and is requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 5-27-22 at 8;30 am for status conference, by zoom.
  This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Zachary William Burris in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac as a friend of the court.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pretrial Conference held.  Court addressed no contact order and takes no action to amend order.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Court ordered no contact with EYB (12/8/76)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Zachary William Burris in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Zachary William Burris in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Zachary William Burris appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  
This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
